<p>Want to make a <em>KSP</em> video like some of your favorite creators? huin’s <a href="http://bit.ly/1vUdZog"><strong>KERBCAM</strong></a> will help get you there. <strong>Kerbcam</strong> helps with camera movement and orientation control among a whole host of major features.</p>

<ul><li>Keyed pathing and playback. Create and edit keys, each of which controls the orientation and position of the camera relative to the spacecraft at a given time on the path. Path playback attempts to smoothly interpolate from one point to the next.</li>

<li>6-degrees-of-freedom camera controller. No longer be limited to camera positions that are simple rotations around the craft.</li>

<li>Path recording (and playback) and camera movement while paused. This is actually an accidental feature, but one that is very handy for preparatory recording of a path or taking a screenshot while a lot of action is going on. (suggest creating and selecting the new path before pausing to workaround a glitch for now). This should also allow for cool “bullet-time” like effects (albeit with the game paused rather than slowed down).</li>

<li>Keyframed linearly interpolated time slowdown/pausing. (bullet time effect)</li>

</ul><p>Click <a href="http://bit.ly/1vUdZog"><strong>HERE</strong></a> to download Kerbcam.</p>
